name: yarn production, cotton, ring spinning, for knitting | yarn, cotton | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/20112/documentation

The activity begins with the opening of cotton bales and ends with the yarn for knitted fabric. It includes electricity use, heat use and the cotton fibres. No lubricating oil needed as the dataset is specific for cotton, which contains natural materials providing lubrication in spinning.;Data collected from mostly vertically integrated mills on a global level. ;Because there were;not enough mills to maintain confidentiality for;rotor or air-jet spinning, data for all spinning;methods were rolled together into a production;weighted average for a global average;spinning process for woven fabrics.

The activity starts from opening of bales.

The activity ends with spinning and winding after which yarn for knitted fabric is conditioned for packaging.
category: C:Manufacturing/13:Manufacture of textiles/131:Spinning, weaving and finishing of textiles/1311:Preparation and spinning of textile fibres

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: The data are based on primary data collected by cotton Inc.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Data set represents average technology.;Once the yarn is received in packaged form, it is placed in creel to feed the knitting zone into the feeder. Upon setting the specific yarn as per the fabric requirement, machine is set as per specific design requirement and the machine processes yarn into loops culminating into production of fabric.
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: Extrapolated from data from mostly vertically integrated mills.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: The data are based on primary data collected by cotton Inc.
